sky eagle wrote:
> 
> 
> Me too looking forward to reading it. I met a problem of mocking collection.
> (Maybe not similar, but I didn't read through the code LuiZ gave:)
> My problem is that
> ===== Code starts =======================
> public override void MethodToBeTested(IInterpretable interpretable,
> XmlElement e)
> {
> ......
> foreach (IInterpretable item in interpretable.GetItems())
> {
> DoSomethingOn(item);
> }
> }
> =====Code ends =====
> Each time I want to test the method (MethodToBeTested) with NMock, I have to
> mock serveral children items and add them to the list.
> =====Code starts (test method)=====
> ......
> IList<IInterpretable> items = new List<IInterpretable>();
> items.Add(t0);
> items.Add(v);
> items.Add(t1);
> ......
> Expect.AtLeastOnce.On(str).Method("GetItems
> ").WithNoArguments().Will(Return.Value(items));
> ===== Code ends =====
> Creating items is tediously, is there a better solution?

I would try extracting the foreach loop into its own little method, then 
test that method separately from the larger MethodToBeTested. This way, 
you can write the tedious child-creating code for fewer tests.
